entry.content:
Hi @Muhammad_HamzaMalik , 

I can recommend the following learning journeys to start with an overview of Employee Central Core and Position Management, which are included in the scope of the SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Certification Associate.

https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/configure-sap-successfactors-employee-central-core

To practice the exercises included in this learning journey, you can enroll to a Hands On Practice System, a safe environment with Instance/Back End access to learn, and included in the SAP Learning hub subscription. Note there are separate systems, since the learning journey includes EC Core, and EC Position Management.

  • https://learning.sap.com/practice-systems/sap-successfactors-employee-central-core-academy
  • https://learning.sap.com/practice-systems/sap-successfactors-position-management-academy

If you don't have yet an SAP Learning Hub subscription, you can check here for more details: https://www.sap.com/training-certification/learning-hub.html

Hope this will help, 

Best regards, 

Jordi

entry.title: Kicking Off LangGraph Agents ü¶ú üîó from SAP Joule Studio üíé üíª
entry.content:
1 ‚Äì Why this matters üí™

Until now, Joule conversations were mostly synchronous: the copilot fetched data, reasoned, and replied in one go. But many business processes need long-running, multi-step logic (think document routing, complex approvals, or data harmonisation) that should continue well after the user closes the chat.

Thanks to the July 2025 Joule Studio update, a Skill can now hit any HTTP endpoint configured as a Destination. If that endpoint points to a Flask app wrapping a LangGraph agent, Joule can fire off the request and immediately return control to the user. The LangGraph agent then runs independently, using:

  • SAP BTP AI Core for scalable LLM calls or fine-tuned models

  • SAP Integration Suite for robust connectivity to SAP and non-SAP back ends

  • Whatever graph logic you design: retries, memory, parallel tools, you name it

The result is a loosely coupled pattern: Joule handles the conversational UX; LangGraph handles the orchestration; BTP services supply compute and integrations.

 

2 ‚Äì How the plumbing works üîó

  1. Package your LangGraph agent as a Flask server

    Inside the POST /invoke handler, accept JSON from Joule, run the graph, and return 202 Accepted. Optionally persist a  correlation ID.

  2. Deploy to SAP BTP (Kyma / Cloud Foundry)

    Expose the route only internally.

  3. Create a Destination

    In your BTP sub-account set ProxyType = Internet (Kyma) or OnPremise (Cloud Connector) and enable WebIDEEnabled.

  4. Add a Joule Skill

    In Joule Studio ‚ûî Data Services, import the OpenAPI spec (or point to the /openapi.json of your Flask app) and map inputs/outputs.

  5. Call it from chat

    When the user says ‚ÄúLaunch quarterly risk analysis‚Äù, Joule issues a POST, gets a 202, and replies: ‚ÄúSure, I‚Äôve launched the analysis. I‚Äôll notify you when it‚Äôs done.‚Äù

 

3 ‚Äì What this unlocks in France or Belgium üíº

Automated PDF contract review for a Belgian insurer

User: ¬´ Analyse ce contrat RC Auto et signale les clauses √† risque ¬ª

Flow: Joule uploads the PDF ‚ûî triggers LangGraph ‚ûî agent calls AI Core for document parsing and legal-clause LLM prompts ‚ûî Integration Suite writes findings back to S/4HANA CM. A Teams message notifies the underwriter when the report is ready.

Regulatory e-invoicing enrichment for French retailers

User: ¬´ Pr√©pare la facture X-France pour Carrefour ¬ª

Flow: Joule fires a LangGraph agent that enriches raw FI data with mandatory e-invoicing fields, queries external tax APIs, validates against Chorus Pro requirements, and pushes the XML to Integration Suite for submission. All without blocking the chat.

Smart maintenance work-package builder for a Benelux chemical plant

User: ¬´ Planifie la r√©vision du compresseur C-450 ¬ª

Flow: Joule triggers a LangGraph graph that checks equipment history, predicts spare-part demand via an ML model in AI Core, reserves materials in S/4HANA, schedules technicians in Field Service Management, and emails a consolidated work order PDF.

 

4 ‚Äì Getting started in your landscape ‚úÖ

  1. Clone the LangGraph Flask boilerplate (SAP Sample GitHub repo).

git clone https://github.com/langchain-ai/new-langgraph-project my_agent
cd my_agent && pip install -e .

 

This gives you the default folder layout with src/agent/graph.py.

  • Add your graph logic

    Implement the state machine, tools, and memory inside src/agent/graph.py exactly as you would for any LangGraph project.

  • Wrap it in a Flask service

    Create an app.py at the project root:

from flask import Flask, request
from src.agent.graph import app as graph  # compiled LangGraph app

flask_app = Flask(__name__)

@flask_app.post("/invoke")
def invoke():
    payload = request.get_json(force=True)
    run_id = graph.invoke_async(payload)  # non-blocking
    return ("", 202, {"X-Run-ID": run_id})‚Äã

      4. Tell LangGraph to use Flask

      Edit langgraph.json:

{
  "graphs": { "agent": "./src/agent/graph.py:graph" },
  "http":   { "app": "./app.py:flask_app" }
}

  1. Containerize and push to SAP BTP

    • Cloud Foundry: cf push my-agent

    • Kyma: build an OCI image and kubectl apply -f deployment.yaml

     

  2. Create a Destination

    In your BTP sub-account, set Type = HTTP, choose OAuth2 Client Credentials (or principal propagation through Cloud Connector), and point the URL to /invoke.

  3. Import the endpoint as a Joule Skill

    In Joule Studio ‚Üí Data Services ‚Üí Import from Destination, load the OpenAPI spec or manually define the POST request.

  4. Chat, trigger and iterate

    Ask Joule: ‚ÄúLance l‚Äôanalyse de risque trimestrielle.‚Äù Joule calls the /invoke route, gets a 202 response, and immediately tells the user the job has started. Use notifications (Teams, e-mail, SAP Mobile Start) to report completion.

You now have a fully decoupled ‚Äúfire-and-forget‚Äù pattern: Joule for conversation, LangGraph for orchestration, AI Core for heavy LLM calls, and Integration Suite for back-end connectivity, all glued together by a single Destination.

 

5 ‚Äì Why this is a big deal üéØ

  • Decouple UX from heavy workflows - users get instant confirmation; complex logic runs in the background.

  • Reuse BTP services you already own - AI Core, Integration Suite, Event Mesh, CAP apps.

  • Lean path to innovation for hybrid customers - no need to upgrade core ERP before piloting AI-powered assistants.

  • Future-proof architecture - swap the Flask server with any containerized runtime; switch models in AI Core; extend graphs without touching Joule.

 

Early pilots show cycle-time reductions of 40 % on multi-step tasks, with minimal change management, because users just chat!

Ready to let Joule pull LangGraph‚Äôs trigger?
Your first ‚Äúfire-and-forget‚Äù Skill is only a Flask endpoint away. üöÄ

entry.title: Presen√ßa no SAP Inside Track SP 2025 ( SITSP2025)
entry.content:
Os curadores da comunidade SAP do RJ ( @Leo_coelho76, @michellemachado e @EduardoPalafoz ),  participaram dos eventos realizados em S√£o Paulo, que foi realizado em 26/07/2025 .

O evento teve seu inicio na sexta feira com o Code Jam, onde Michelle assistiu a apresenta√ß√£o conduzida pelo Josh barba azul ( josh_bentley), em paralelo fui ajudar os curadores de SP ( @RobertaFernande) na prepara√ß√£o de alguns pontos.

No s√°bado, Leonardo, Michelle e Eu, comparecemos no evento. Leo e Eu fizemos parte da equipe volunt√°ria, registrando o momento com fotos. J√° Michelle, foi obter mais conhecimento t√©cnico com o sitdev.

Foi um s√°bado com uma variedade de conte√∫do para funcionais, como reforma tribut√°ria entre outros temas e para Dev, btp e etc. Acredito que teve um publico de 400 pessoas e posso garantir, foi sensacional.

 

O SAP Inside track √© um evento focado para Comunidade SAP, onde acontece o compartilhamento de conhecimento entre palestrantes e Consultores SAP.

√â um evento que vejo uma boa forma de networking entre as pessoas e, uma coisa que sempre enfatizo √© que os palestrantes 'Deuses' que vemos no LinkedIn ou em webinar, s√£o simples mortais onde qualquer pessoa pode acess√°-los para conversar, tirar d√∫vidas, fotos e curiosidades e eles sempre s√£o bem acess√≠veis.

Desta forma, a comunidade do Rio de Janeiro pretende fazer mais eventos para networking.

SAP Community 

SAP Inside Track

entry.title: SAP Service Cloud V2 Utilities Add-on - Extending Utility Premise Object -> PART II
entry.content:
Introduction

As part of the process to extend the data replication of Premise with a custom field, this blog focus on the step to add this field to the Premise object in SAP Service Cloud V2 and then through adaption have the field visible on the Premise view.

This is part II of 3 blogs covering the steps to achieve this.

Part I - SAP Service Cloud V2 Utilities Add-on - Extending Premise Replication with Custom Field

Part II - This blog

Part III - Update Mapping in SAP Data Integration Suite (still to come)

 

Adding field to Premise Object

Under settings in SAP Service Cloud V2, select ‚ÄòExtensibility Administration‚Äô and find the Premise object.

 

 

Then click the ‚Äò+‚Äô sign to add a field.

Fill in the required fields. The technical name is important for us later, as this is what we to refer to when creating the mapping between the field send from SAP S/4HANA and this field.

 

 

Verify that API contains the added attribute

We can also check if the field is available now, by calling the service using a tool like Postman or Bruno. In addition to the URL, the call must be configured to use authentication, e.g. user and password if Basic Authentication is used.

Replace '{tenantID}' with your tenant id.

https://{tenantID}/sap/c4c/api/v1/repository-service/openApiSchemas/sap.crm.premiseservice.api.premiseS4ReplicationIn

Even without any custom extension, there is a structure reserved for these under 'extensions'. At the bottom of the response, you will the field just defined in SAP Service Cloud V2.

 

 

With the above defined, SAP Service Cloud V2, will accept the custom field when mapped to the extension structure.

 

Use Adaptation to add the custom field to the Premise View

In order for the field to be visible for a user, we add this to the Premise view, using adaptation.

The plan is to place this field in the 'Details' section. Selecting the '+' sign and the 'pencil' provides access to all fields that be configured for this section. This is both for standard delivered fields and custom fields.

Select 'Add from List' and then 'Extensions' - this is where all custom extended fields will be visible.

On the list we have 'Roof Type'

Select this using the '+' sign and then select 'Apply'. The field is now available on the view:

This completes the steps needed for SAP Service Cloud V2.

In the next blog we will take the final step to create a mapping between the field send from SAP S/4HANA and the receiving field in SAP Service Cloud V2.

entry.title: Escalation Email for Pending Approvals in SAP Business ByDesign
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

My company is currently working with SAP Business ByDesign, and I have a question regarding approval workflows.

Is there a way to set up an automatic escalation email if a Purchase Order or Invoice approval has not been completed within a certain time frame (e.g., 3 days)? Ideally, I would like the system to:

  • Notify the requester that the approval is overdue

  • Trigger an escalation email to a superior or next-level approver if no action has been taken

Questions:

  1. Can this type of escalation logic be configured in ByDesign?

  2. Is it possible to automatically trigger these emails without manual intervention?

  3. Are there any recommended workarounds using workflow rules or scheduled reports?

Any insights or suggestions would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: The non-valuation of inter-projects and intra-project...
entry.content:
You‚Äôre using movement type 344 Q (and its reverse 343 Q) to move valuated Q-stock between WBS elements and sometimes only the material document is posted‚Äîno FI document. That leaves sending projects holding value with zero stock and receiving ones holding stock with zero value.

Movement type 344 Q is the reversal of 343 Q (goods issue from one project to another).  A correctly configured 344 Q should post a material document and an accounting document that debits the receiving WBS and credits the sending WBS at the stock valuation price.

The standard FI posting logic is whenever you post a cross-project transfer of valuated stock, SAP generates:

  • A material document for quantity movement
  • A parallel accounting document valuing the movement at the issuing stock‚Äôs valuation price

If the accounting document is missing, the root cause is most often in customizing or update failures, not a normal system behavior.

Potential root causes are

The ‚ÄúGL update‚Äù indicator may be disabled for 344 Q. Check in SPRO under Materials Management ‚Üí Inventory Management ‚Üí Movement Types ‚Üí Copy, Change Movement Types that 344 Q is set to trigger real‚Äêtime accounting.

In OBYC, ensure your transaction keys for Q-stock use the proper valuation class and G/L accounts. A missing or wrong entry can silently skip FI.

Validate in SPRO ‚Üí Project System ‚Üí Integration with Other Components ‚Üí Materials Management that Q-stock transfers to other WBS always post to CO and FI.

Use SM13 to check for failed update requests. Look in SM21 for dump entries immediately after your inconsistent postings.

If you run ML, cross-plant or cross-project postings may require additional ledgers. Verify whether secondary cost elements or ledger groups are suppressing FI.

So the troubleshooting steps would be

  • Post identical 344 Q transfers in a non-productive client. Compare accounting output. Turn on ST05 SQL trace for user and transaction MIGO, filter on tables MSEG, BSEG. See if the FI insert ever fires.
  • Pull two material documents (one with FI, one without). Compare the Document Header (MKPF), Accounting Document Link fields, and whether a commit happened after FI.
  • In OMWA check that movement type 344 Q uses the correct transaction key for account determination. Run OBYC checks for keys: BSX, WRX, PRD, VBR.
  • Confirm users have rights for both MM and FI postings. A missing FI authorization can post materials only.

entry.title: Re: How to prevent billing plan value greater than sales...
entry.content:
Ok so in that case, you can use BAdI C_SALESORDER_MANAGE_CHECK which fires just before the order is committed. Inside your BAdI implementation you will:

  • Read each sales‚Äêorder item‚Äôs billing plan via the standard OData API or class (e.g. CL_SALESORDER_BILLINGPLAN=>GET_PLAN)
  • Sum up all billing‚Äêplan values
  • Compare to the item‚Äôs net value (ITM_NET_VALUE)
  • If the billing plan total > net value, call the BAdI‚Äôs error and prevents the order from saving.

entry.title: Goods receipt to special stock type E for the cross-company code returns process.
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

We are currently implementing the cross-company sales process and have set up the corresponding returns process in accordance with Scope Item 2F4. During testing, we observed that when posting the goods receipt for a return, the system does not assign Special Stock Type "E" (Orders on Hand), but instead posts the stock to Blocked Stock without any Special Stock Type.

This issue seems restricted to the context of cross-company returns. For example, if both sales organization and return plant are under the same company code, the Special Stock ‚ÄúE‚Äù assignment works correctly.

We have confirmed that our item category, schedule line category, movement type (657), and plant configuration are correctly maintained. However, the expected special stock behavior is missing only for cross-company returns.

Can you please clarify:

  • Is this standard system behavior in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
  • If yes, what is the recommendation for tracking returned stock by sales order in such scenarios?
  • Are there workarounds or extensibility options available?

Thank you in advance.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Goods receipt to special stock type E for the cross-c...
entry.content:
This is expected system behavior in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, particularly under Scope Item 2F4 (Cross-Company Returns).

In cross-company returns, SAP does not support Special Stock Type ‚ÄúE‚Äù (Sales Order Stock). This is because:

  • The return plant and the original selling company code are different legal entities
  • As such, stock cannot be tied to a specific sales order for valuation and legal reasons
  • Therefore, the system posts the returned goods into Blocked Stock without assigning Special Stock Type "E"

This behavior is also documented in SAP Help for scope item 2F4:

‚ÄúCross-company returns do not support sales order stock tracking.‚Äù

Workarounds

  1. Use plants within the same company code for return flows where Special Stock Type ‚ÄúE‚Äù is needed
  2. If available in your project scope, build custom logic to store the sales order reference in a custom field during return posting, allowing traceability without native Special Stock handling would require consulting 2706322 - What is Support ‚Äì What is Consulting: Cloud Solutions
  3. Submit a feature request to SAP via the Influence Portal: 2963059 - How to Submit Feature Requests for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Re: „Äêsolved „ÄëAn error occurred while installing SAP S/4HA...
entry.content:
My Solution:

Before registering HANA, uninstall lss.

Uninstall lss

# cd /lss/shared/HDB/install

# ./hdbuninst

 

Register HANA

# /hana/shared/HDB/hdblcm/hdblcm --action=register_rename_system

Cancel registration if attempt to start lss is unsuccessful

 

Reinstall lss from Server install file "IMDB_SERVER20_082_0-80002031.SAR"

First extract Files with hdblcm

# /hana/shared/HDB/hdblcm/hdblcm

6 - extract_components

 

Delete old lss folder (I think that's optional)

# rm -r /lss

# rm -r /lss_home/

# cd /hana/shared/HDB/

# unlink lss

 

Reinstall lss

# /hana/shared/HDB/hdblcm/hdblcm

13 - update

 

Rename HANA

# /hana/shared/HDB/hdblcm/hdblcm

10 | rename_system

entry.title: Re: Cummulative business volume for scale basis-Settlemen...
entry.content:
Settlement Management in SAP S/4HANA 2023 provides a unified framework to manage royalties agreements and calculate accruals and settlements based on defined business volumes. By defining one business volume for cumulative billing (to pick the rate) and a second period-related volume for the actual posting base, you can drive monthly accruals and quarterly settlements with just standard customizing.

First, you have to define two Business Volume Types. So go to SPRO ‚Üí Sales and Distribution ‚Üí Settlement Management ‚Üí Basic Settings ‚Üí Business Volume ‚Üí Define Business Volume Types. There

  • Create ZCUM (Cumulative Billing Value): leave as period-independent
  • Create ZMON (Monthly Billing Value): flag as Period-related so that you can post only each month‚Äôs delta

Next, Configure Business Volume Controls and for that, go to SPRO ‚Üí Sales and Distribution ‚Üí Settlement Management ‚Üí Basic Settings ‚Üí Business Volume ‚Üí Define Business Volume Controls

  • For ZMON, enable ‚ÄúDifference from Last Period‚Äù to derive only the month‚Äôs billing value
  • Leave ZCUM as an absolute cumulative total (used solely for tier/rate lookup)

Then, assign Business Volumes in Your Contract & Conditions and for that, go to SPRO ‚Üí Settlement Management ‚Üí Basic Settings ‚Üí Contract ‚Üí Condition Contract Types, map ZCUM and ZMON as the two business-volume fields on your royalty contract type.

Create two custom condition types:

  • ZYR_ACCR (Monthly Accrual), Business Volume = ZMON, Scale Basis = ZCUM
  • ZYR_SETT (Quarterly Settlement), Business Volume = ZMON, Scale Basis = ZCUM

Copy standard procedure BSETTL ‚Üí ZBSTTL. In ZBSTTL, insert ZYR_ACCR and ZYR_SETT into the sequence. For each condition type, choose the appropriate base-value formula 214 or 216, so that ZMON is picked up correctly

Monthly Accrual Run: System reads ZMON (period delta) and applies the rate fetched from ZCUM to calculate your royalties accrual for that month.
Quarterly Partial Settlement: System again uses ZMON with its ‚Äúdifference from last period‚Äù logic to pick up only the last three months‚Äô billing‚Äîand looks at the updated ZCUM to derive the rate for that quarter.

entry.title: Re: FI asset accounting migration in the current fiscal year
entry.content: @Chuma According to our Rules of Engagement, I have added the " GenAI was used to help generate this content " statement to your answer, as the content has been AI-generated. Transparency is key when it comes to AI, we therefore require that AI-generated content is marked as such: "If you want to publish content that was helped/created by GenAI, you must add the user tag GenAI Assisted Content. For content where it's not possible to add a user tag (e.g., answers), you must include this statement: "GenAI was used to help generate this content."

entry.title: Subcontracting process - Two freight costs
entry.content:
Dears, 

Need help in the following scenario. 

Subcontracting PO created (category L) for material managed with moving average price, to send the material to be repaired. 

In the moment of the PO creation we introduce the freight value of the transportation to the vendor in pricing condition FRB1. 

After, we send the material to the vendor through ADSUBCON (with delivery creation; mov. type 541). 

The following step is to post in MIRO the invoice only for the planned freight costs introduced in the PO.

With the material still at the vendor's, they request the payment of the freight associated with the transportation back to our facilities. This freight wasn't consider initially in the PO and is not possible to change the PO due to the invoice already registered. 

How to invoice the freight cost to the vendor without reversing the invoice already introduced (to be able to change the PO), and guaranteeing that when doing the GR of the material both freight costs are inputted to it?

Thank you.

Regards, 

PT

Hi,

By business decisions our recruiters can only start a New Requisition to Position with field Vacant=Yes in the SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting module#. At reporting level we need to split the information the recruiters can see, for example one recruiter can only start requisition to vacant position from Vicepresidency A but we need them to see all the requisitions (Vacant=Yes AND Vacant=No) status on a Story Report we build. We create a Target Group with the filter by Vicepresidency, however the process role to open requisitions for only Vacant=Yes positions is not leting them to see all the requisitions, only those with Vacant=Yes. An automatic process change the Vacant field to No once a candidate moves forward the Onboarding proces

Is there any possibility to avoid this conflict on permissions?

Best regards,

Juan

entry.title: Clicking 'Complete requirement' for a curriculum lists only 50 items - Customer Influence- Pls Vote
entry.content:
Hello SF Community,

Currently there is a gap in the new learning home where, when we click 'Complete Requirement' for a curriculum, the pop-up displays only 50 items instead of the full course list, which contains more. This restricts the user's ability to see the entire list of items in the requirement pool and complete them. However, if the user opens the curriculum from the curricula tile, they can see the complete list of courses.

The complete requirement pop list should contain all the available items in the given curriculum requirement pool so that learning users can see all the choices they have to complete a curriculum requirement.

Related KBA-3635921

A Customer Influence Request has been created for this. Improvement Request Details - Customer Influence.

If you think this will be helpful for you, please vote for the customer influence idea.

Best Regards, MSY

entry.title: Re: Subcontracting process - Two freight costs
entry.content:
When you‚Äôve already done MIRO against the subcontracting PO (category L) and can‚Äôt reverse it, the easiest supported way to pick up extra inbound freight‚Äîand have it flow into your repaired‚Äêmaterial valuation at GR‚Äîis to use MIRO‚Äôs ‚ÄúPlanned Delivery Cost‚Äù option. SAP will post a separate freight line on the invoice, then automatically apportion all freight (both original and new) into inventory when you do the GR of the repaired material.

Your FRB1 must be defined as actual freight in the PO (not provisional) and flagged for inventory valuation (in condition‚Äêtype customizing). OBYC must have the proper G/L for freight ‚Üí inventory, so that freight lines capitalize into stock. When you later do the GR (movement 543 for return of repaired material), SAP:

  • Picks up all posted planned‚Äêdelivery‚Äêcost entries
  • Apportions them proportionally into the material‚Äôs moving‚Äêaverage price
  • Posts the final inventory value with both freight components included

If you want a ‚Äúcleaner‚Äù audit trail, you can treat the extra freight as a subsequent debit, Create a new MIRO with Subsequent Debit/Credit indicator (still reference the same PO). Enter the freight G/L and amount manually and post it. This hits a freight‚Äêliability account and posts to freight expense, but it won‚Äôt automatically capitalize into inventory‚Äîso you‚Äôd need a separate adjustment (MR11 or manual journal) at GR time.

entry.title: Re: How to set Application Version for MDK Client?
entry.content:
When using the Application Versioning in Mobile Services to restrict connections you need to specify the version to match the AppVersion from the MDKProject.json of your client.  When you add this restriction any clients not matching the versions will get an error when trying to onboard.

Alternately you can add logic into your MDK metadata to check the client version using clientAPI.getVersionInfo() and check the "Application Version" and determine how you want to proceed in those scenarios as well.

entry.title: Re: Service entry sheet
entry.content:
By standard SAP logic, ML81N only picks up PO lines that the system recognizes as ‚Äúservices.‚Äù Text‚Äêonly or pure material lines won‚Äôt appear. To enable SES creation without a true material master, you have two supported options:

In your PO, change the line‚Äôs Item Category to D. Leave the ‚ÄúService‚Äù field blank or assign an internal dummy service number (from your service‚Äêmaster number range). When you go into ML81N:

  • Choose Create ‚Üí Other Purchase Order (Shift+F5) ‚Üí enter your PO.
  • The line appears as a service item (even without a real material master).
  • You can manually enter description, quantity, and net price in the Service Entry Sheet.

Save the SES. SAP generates the entry‚Äêsheet number and posts the service‚ÄêGR accounting without needing a material master.

The other option is to create a new service master record (Material Type DIEN) with only the absolutely required fields (short text, unit, and valuation class). Reference this dummy service master in your PO line (item category D still applies). ML81N will pick up the line automatically‚Äîno manual line creation required. This approach preserves the end-to-end traceability of the SES back to a service master and still sidesteps having a full material BOM or other master data.

entry.title: 2025 Q3 SAP Analytics Cloud compass Highlights
entry.content:
In the coming QRC3 release, compass users will be seeing two new features which will ease risk analysis further for end users: Relative range input and conflict driver detection.

Relative Range Input

Compass users will be able to enter their assumption for driver uncertainties as relative values, i.e. as offsets to the current baseline in the model. The offsets could be entered as percentage or numbers.  During input, a display below the input will show the converted absolute value for immediate visual validation.
Entering driver uncertainties as offsets will allow the capturing of assumptions which is more aligned with the business language, and also an easy application of the same effect (e.g. +5%) across different drivers. 
Another cool detail: Publishing a scenario will convert the relative inputs into absolute values for the public scenario, but once a private copy is create from this result, the input will be converted back into the relative ranges again. This is to respect the different needs between result consumption (public scenario) and scenario modelling (private scenario). 

Conflict Driver Detection

Scenario modelling is a very volatile process, and usually users are capturing their assumptions at the speed of their thoughts. During such a process it might at times lead to them creating conflicting drivers unintentionally, such as setting up driver uncertainties for overlapping drivers. An example could e.g. setting up uncertainties for revenue in Europe and Germany at the same time for the same scenario run (Germany is part of Europe, hence the overlap). In such cases, compass will indicate the conflict, assisting users to maintain a leaner and cleaner driver list with valid configurations. 

With these two new features we hope to boost the efficiency of scenario modelling for end users, making risk analysis even more approachable for business users. 
New to compass? Take a look at these blogs:

    • Introduction to Monte Carlo Simulation
    • General Release of SAP Analytics Cloud compass
    • A Step-By-Step Walkthrough for SAP Analytics Cloud compass (PART I)
    • A Step-By-Step Walkthrough for SAP Analytics Cloud compass (PART II)

 

‚ÄÉ

entry.title: Re: Check Field and Value Check foreign key table (depend...
entry.content:
Hello @nasuke232 

Yes, based on the screenshots and code you provided, your understanding and implementation of foreign key checks in ABAP using check tables are technically correct. Here's a brief summary and validation:

You have a foreign key relationship where:

Table ZTEST1111 is the foreign key table (dependent table).

Table ZTEST111 is the check table (referenced table).

Field DOCMT in ZTEST1111 is linked to the composite primary key in ZTEST111, which includes MANDT, RBUKRS, BELNR, DOCLN.

In your Excel upload validation logic, you:

Fetch the check table's primary key metadata using DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET.

Loop over those PK fields.

Dynamically build a WHERE clause to validate if any value from Excel exists in the check table.

Raise an error message if no match is found.

However, one caveat:

Your current validation logic:

CONCATENATE ls_keyinfo-fieldname '= _excel_value' INTO lv_where.

Means you are validating only one field at a time, even though your check table has multiple primary keys (MANDT, RBUKRS, BELNR, DOCLN). That can lead to false positives or false negatives.
What You Should Do Instead (if validating full record):

Build a dynamic WHERE clause covering all primary key fields like this:

LOOP AT lt_pk_fields INTO ls_keyinfo WHERE keyflag = 'X'.
CONCATENATE lv_where ls_keyinfo-fieldname '=' value_from_excel_for_this_field 'AND' INTO lv_where SEPARATED BY space.
ENDLOOP.

Then use:

SELECT SINGLE * FROM (lv_check_tab) WHERE (lv_where) INTO lv_exists.

SAP Help References Documentation

SAP Help: Creating Foreign Keys

Table DD05P ‚Äì Foreign Key Info

Let me know how it works

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Cummulative business volume for scale basis-Settlemen...
entry.content:
Hi @sumit_chourasia1,

your example for August indicates that a graduated-to interval scale is used: 4% for 90k to 100k plus 3% for 100K to 120k. In total 0,4k + 0,6k = 1,0k. As already described a standard solution for graduated scales does not exist, but a custom solution is possible. Such a solution will work on cumulated values.

Further information regarding graduated scales: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/7b24a64d9d0941bda1afa753263d9e39/45f5b9537cceb44ce10000000a174cb4.html.

Regards,
Michael

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to implement workflow in FB60 or FV60...
entry.content:
Hi @lmargon 

Thank you for your question.

I have listed below the required step-by-step guide to configure the Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices in SAP S/4HANA, which is applicable for invoices posted directly via FB60 or parked via FV60:

  1. Activate the flexible workflow scenario in SPRO under Business Workflow settings.
  2. Enable the workflow in Invoice Verification customizing (Logistics Invoice Verification ‚Üí Flexible Workflow).
  3. Assign required SAP Fiori roles and catalogs (e.g., SAP_CA_BC_MYINBOX) to workflow users.
  4. Use the SAP Fiori app Manage Workflows for Supplier Invoices to activate and configure workflow scenarios, define start conditions, add approval steps, and assign recipients.
  5. Test parked or direct invoices to ensure workflow triggers and approval tasks are routed correctly.

This approach allows you to implement condition-based invoice approval workflows without involving MM purchase orders.

Should you require more detailed step-by-step process flow, please feel free to reach out.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. 

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Transfer of the HUs from Outbound to Inbound
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community

I need your assistance with an issue related to the transfer of handling units from outbound delivery to inbound delivery. 

As part of an intercompany or intracompany PO/STO process, we are encountering an unexpected behavior related to Handling Units (HUs).

The context is as follows:

  • HUs are properly scanned and created during the Outbound Delivery (OD) and posted at the time of the Goods Issue (GI).
  • However, during the inbound process, these HUs are not automatically transferred into the Inbound Delivery (IBD).
  • Instead of being integrated into the pick/pack structure, they are brought in as additional product lines, which blocks the Goods Receipt (GR) process.

 Technical Environment:

  • We are not using EWM (Extended Warehouse Management) or SAP Event Management (EM).
  • The entire process is managed through custom routines.

Issues caused:

  1. Loss of visibility of the actual packaging structure used at shipment (e.g., pallets, cartons).
  2. Manual repacking is required at the receiving site, or the pallet line must be manually deleted from the IBD to allow GR to proceed.

Thanks all for your help.

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: Improvements to Wave Simulation Stock Checks and Logging
entry.content:
Hello @yogesh_agarwal2 

1. A Batch in Restricted-Use. This field helps sort stock that's still under quality inspection or restricted status.

  • Use it if you want to prioritise or avoid such batches during picking.
  • Descending = checked ‚Üí picks newer restricted-use batches.
  • Descending = unchecked ‚Üí picks older ones.
    Only works if restricted-use stock is allowed in your stock removal strategy.

1.b SKZSI ‚Äì Blocking Indicator
SKZSI flags blocked inventory.

  • It‚Äôs a sort-only field, not a filter ‚Äî it won‚Äôt prevent blocked stock from being picked.
  • Descending = unchecked ‚Üí sorts unblocked stock first (recommended).
  • Descending = checked ‚Üí may pull blocked stock first (usually not ideal).
    Best practice: Use this with a proper stock type exclusion or storage type strategy to truly avoid blocked bins.

Let me know how it goes

With regards

Chuma

entry.content: @RaminS question is if the service works appropriately with the conversion exit in place or causes various of the issues described in this blog. If you are sure about the same,  the only option currently would be to modify the code and add the exit to the allow list. There is no official extension option offered.

entry.title: Re: How to refresh/update MX_DISABLED attribute in the ID...
entry.content: Still no success, i already tried the logoff and the refresh, and the third option, i will validate the cache on the java machine configuration

entry.title: SAP Developer News August 7th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

PODCAST: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/08/07/%f0%9f%94%94sap-developer-news-august-7th-2025/ 

SAP Developer Challenge 

  • Fiori Element With Flexible Programming Model Developer Challenge August 2025: https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-blog-posts/sap-community-escape-house-for-august-fiori-element-with-flexible/ba-p/14167685 

Using Jupyter in SAP Business Application Studio and in SAP Business Data Cloud 

  • Using Jupyter in SAP Business Application Studio: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/using-jupyter-in-sap-business-application-studio-my-notes/ba-p/14167294 
  • Using conda-forge in SAP Business Application Studio: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/using-conda-forge-in-sap-business-application-studio-my-notes/ba-p/14169956  
  • Hands-on Jupyter in SAP Databricks: https://community.sap.com/t5/artificial-intelligence-and-machine-learning-blogs/hands-on-tutorial-sap-databricks/ba-p/14156999 
  • Unlocking SAP AI Foundation capabilities in SAP Databricks: A technical deep dive: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/unlocking-sap-ai-foundation-capabilities-in-sap-databricks-a-technical-deep/ba-p/14162714  
  • Recordings and Slides from webinar series 'Architecting Your SAP Business Data Cloud Journey': https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-architecture-blog-posts/recordings-and-slides-from-webinar-series-architecting-your-sap-business/ba-p/14163802   

Devtoberfest Fun Activities 

  • Devtoberfest Home Page: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/gh-p/Devtoberfest 
  • Devtoberfest Social Media Announcement: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/sap-developers_get-ready-devtoberfest-by-sap-teched-in-activity-7354571776418324480-OPqH?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAAAO_6sQB6ZWQRLHA4I-AqpHfE4_c2OZCYEI 
  • Devtoberfest YouTube Playlist from 2024: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL6RpkC85SLQDHz97qsNTNAE2jnUKj8X5d 
  • HIDDEN BONUS: Scramble puzzle already published that will be part of the fun activities ‚Äì earn points already: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-fun-scramble-languages.html  
  • A good primer on cryptic crosswords: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c9ZtJMAVqqY 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 SAP Developer Challenge 

1:09 Demojam Promo 

1:45 Using Jupyter in SAP Business Application Studio and in SAP Business Data Cloud 

3:15 Devtoberfest Fun Activities 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for August the 7th, 2025.

[Amar] Hello, SAP developers. The August Developer Challenge now live and available in SAP developers‚Äô community. In this month, we are diving into SAP Fiori element with flexible programming model. If you ever wanted to go beyond the standard template and tailor your app's behavior with powerful custom logic, this challenge is for you. You will get hands-on experience with flexible programming model, learn how to use extensions point, building block and controller extensions to enhance your Fiori element application. I highly recommend checking it out. The blog post with all the details about the challenge is linked below in the video description. As always, all the participants who will complete this challenge will earn the SAP Community patch. I hope you'll like it. Bye-bye.

[Tom] Hi dear, I got the demojam trophy for the winner of the Demojam at SAP TechEd Berlin this year. Thats right, demojam is back again this year and the team with the best demo will be voted on by the audience and get this fabulous price. So ,I hope everyone is looking forward to a great show this year, there are teams hard at work building on their demos as we speak. And whether you're in person Berlin or joining us online for the virtual event, you'll be able to tune in and see all the excitement of Demo Jam. So just one more reason to be looking forward to TechEd again this year.

[Witalij] Do you remember my announcement in last week's SAP Developer News about using Python in SAP Business Application Studio? Of course you do, right? This week, I've shared two new blog posts expanding on that topic. The first explores how to use Jupyter Notebooks with SAP Business Application Studio, and the second explains how to set up Conda Forge instead of the default Python virtual environment. These resources should be particularly helpful if you are working on machine learning or AI projects in bus. But what if you want to do something similar in SAP Business Data Cloud? Then you'll want to check out how Jupyter Notebooks work in SAP Databricks. Our Regional Center of Excellence team has you covered. They've published a step-by-step walkthrough for training a time-series forecasting model in SAP Business Data Cloud. What's best? You can do this in basic trial for free. Want to explore SAP Databricks more deeply? Product Management has released a two-part blog series focused specifically on that, packed with technical insights. Oh, and before I forget, recordings from the recent BDC Architecture series, including sessions on SAP Databricks, have just gone live this week. You'll find all the links in the description below.

[Daniel] Devtoberfest is right around the corner, and I hope you've seen our posts on social media. I just wanted to let you know that in addition to the dozens and dozens of learning sessions by the best presenters and the smartest developers, we'll also have a few fun treats. We'll, of course, have Pettoberfest this year with a little bit of Gen AI twist. We'll also have coding challenges, and, of course, we will bring back the SAP cryptic crossword. Now, for you newbies, cryptics are exciting to solve, also exciting to create, and I'll just give you an idea of how they work. It's like getting a crossword puzzle with clues. But unlike a regular crossword, every clue is divided into two. Half of it is a definition like any other crossword. But the other half is a play on words or something that indicates how the word is constructed. And it's your job to figure out where to break up the clue. So, for example, hybris a clue, command to round up horrific lice. Sounds a little bit weird, no? But if you look at it, you can see that you can divide it into two. Command to round up, which is a definition. Any ideas what that could be? And the second part, horrific lice. Horrific indicates it's an anagram of lice. You can rearrange the letters in lice to spell seal, a JavaScript method to round up a number. Pretty cool, no? we'll also have a scavenger hunt that will take you throughout the community throughout our youtube channel github even the help portal and you'll search for clues to the answer to the scavenger hunt and then you'll earn hundreds perhaps thousands of points towards our devtoberfest grand prize more details to come as we approach devtoberfest which starts september 29th.

entry.title: Re: Story - How can I get the latest incumbent of a posit...
entry.content: We‚Äôre having similar issues. We would like a report to show current vacancies. We‚Äôve tried filtering on various date fields, too. When we change the filter to incumbent status to show terminated and null values it shows all the terminated people who have been in those positions even if the positions are currently filled. What field should we use to show positions currently filled and positions currently vacant?
